body:
Interesting...have you tried changing the PS1 script to verify None still
does the right thing? It's in the packages folder.

On Thu, Jul 10, 2014 at 4:04 PM, Drew Marsh notifications@github.com
wrote:

> _Problem:_
> The standard Web Publishing target from Microsoft will publish any items
> of type Content. For whatever reason AutoMapper chose Content as the item
> type for its platform extension assembly which causes the Web Publishing
> target to publish a \packages\Automapper<version><platform assembly>.dll
> file.
> 
> _Proposed fix:_
> Change the item type for the platform assembly from Content to None. This
> should have no impact on the platform assembly actually being copied to the
> output directory since this behavior is governed by the
> CopyToOutputDirectory metadata, not the item type, and the Web Publishing
> target will ignore it because it's no longer Content.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/556.
Negative, was just creating a local branch now to make changes and see what happens. Will submit PR when ready.

Cool. I kept just messing with that .targets until it worked right, then
copied it over to the repo. Easier than going the whole route of building a
new nuget package etc.

On Thu, Jul 10, 2014 at 4:21 PM, Drew Marsh notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Negative, was just creating a local branch now to make changes and see
> what happens. Will submit PR when ready.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/556#issuecomment-48666081
> .

I think this issue is causing applications to fail on AppHarbor. I recently updated to AutoMapper 3.2.1 and this resulted in a packages folder containing the .net4 AutoMapper assembly to be copied to a peer folder of the web build folder, resulting in a deployment failure on AppHarbor. Pretty nasty as the only error you see subsequently on AppHarbor is a "403 - Forbidden: Access Denied" from IIS with no additional debug information as the web application failed even to load.

It took some time and work with the AppHarbor support staff to track the problem down to AutoMapper so I'm commenting here to help others who may hit the same issue.

issue.title: Fix Automapper.targets to not use Content type item

body:
Tested locally and works like a charm. 

For the record, I had the actual .targets file fixed the instant I wrote the original issue, but getting AutoMapper to build locally for testing was not straightforward. There are some issues with the build process related to the way psake clobbers the path and causes an older version of MSBuild to be used which triggers wrong versions of targets files to subsequently be included, even though I don't have that version of the those targets files installed (e.g. pre-2013 when I have a pure 2013 setup here). 

Also, I noticed that actually creating a NuGet package was not part of the automated build. 

I've remedied both these things in the psake script locally, but I've not included them as part of this PR to keep it simple. I will prepare another issue/PR in case you're interested in those changes as well.

issue.title: Strange behavior with AutoMapper.targets when publishing a web application
issue.body:
Hi,

Thank you for giving us AutoMapper it's awesome!

That being said, I'm having a strange issue with the **AutoMapper.targets** file.

When I deploy a web project using [this](http://blog.m.jedynak.pl/2008/03/publishing-web-application-with-msbuild.html) method, the **AutoMapper.targets** file doesn't behave as expected.

The **AutoMapper.Net4.dll** file is copied with the **packages\AutoMapper.3.2.1\lib\net40** path to the **WebProjectOutputDir**, instead of just copying it to the **WebProjectOutputDir\bin** directory.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open Visual Studio.
2. Create an empty solution (e.g. **~\Solution.sln**).
3. Create a web application project (e.g. **~\WebApp\WebApp.csproj**) using .NET Framework 4.5.
4. Add the the **AutoMapper.3.2.1** package to the web project.
5. Create a batch file (e.g. **~\publish.bat**) with the content as defined below.
6. Run the batch file.

**Environment:**
1. Windows 7 Home Premium 64 bit.
2. Visual Studio 2013 Professional.

**publish.bat content:**

``` bat
@echo off
if exist "C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\12.0\bin\amd64\msbuild.exe" (
    :: MSBuild 12.0 64 bit
    set msb="C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\12.0\bin\amd64\msbuild.exe"
) else if exist "C:\Program Files\MSBuild\12.0\bin\msbuild.exe" (
    :: MSBuild 12.0 32 bit
    set msb="C:\Program Files\MSBuild\12.0\bin\msbuild.exe"
) else (
    :: MSBuild 4
    set msb=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\msbuild.exe
)
@echo on
%msb% /t:Clean;Rebuild /p:Configuration=Release;Optimize=True Solution.sln
%msb% /t:ResolveReferences;_CopyWebApplication /p:Configuration=Release;Optimize=True;WebProjectOutputDir=..\Publish\WebApp;OutDir=..\Publish\WebApp\bin WebApp\WebApp.csproj
```

body:
Probably too late, but the way I test my nuget package is just to hand edit
the files in the zip/nuget package, and then create a custom package source
inside VS to just a folder somewhere. That way I don't have to actually
create the package, I just use what's already there.

On Sun, Aug 31, 2014 at 12:42 PM, Drew Marsh notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Tested locally and works like a charm.
> 
> For the record, I had the actual .targets file fixed the instant I wrote
> the original issue, but getting AutoMapper to build locally for testing was
> not straightforward. There are some issues with the build process related
> to the way psake clobbers the path and causes an older version of MSBuild
> to be used which triggers wrong versions of targets files to subsequently
> be included. Also, I noticed that actually creating a NuGet package was not
> part of the automated build. I've remedied both these things in the psake
> script locally, but I've not included them as part of this PR to keep it
> simple. I will prepare another issue/PR in case you're interested in those
> changes as well.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/556#issuecomment-53995306
> .

Since you already have NuGet.exe in the solution I actually added an exec of that to the "deist" task in the build script and have it output to the buld_dir. Then, yeah, I just created a local package source to that for testing.

I'll send another PR with that and you can decide if that's something you'd like to keep or not.

issue.title: Autofac.Integration.Mvc throws FileNotFoundException when ASP.NET app starts up
issue.body:
When our ASP.NET application starts up we get a yellow screen error as follows:

```
Server Error in '/WebSite' Application.

Could not load file or assembly 'Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified. 
  Description: An unhandled exception occurred during the execution of the current web request. Please review the stack trace for more information about the error and where it originated in the code. 

 Exception Details: System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.

Source Error: 


 An unhandled exception was generated during the execution of the current web request. Information regarding the origin and location of the exception can be identified using the exception stack trace below.  

Assembly Load Trace: The following information can be helpful to determine why the assembly 'Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' could not be loaded.



=== Pre-bind state information ===
LOG: DisplayName = Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35
 (Fully-specified)
LOG: Appbase = file:///E:/Foo/Bar/WebSite/
LOG: Initial PrivatePath = E:\Foo\Bar\WebSite\bin
Calling assembly : Autofac.Integration.Mvc, Version=3.3.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=17863af14b0044da.
===
LOG: This bind starts in default load context.
LOG: Using application configuration file: E:\Foo\Bar\WebSite\web.config
LOG: Using host configuration file: C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\aspnet.config
LOG: Using machine configuration file from C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\config\machine.config.
LOG: Post-policy reference: Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///C:/Windows/Microsoft.NET/Framework/v4.0.30319/Temporary ASP.NET Files/WebSite/4ad5a27f/b4576cbe/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure.DLL.
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///C:/Windows/Microsoft.NET/Framework/v4.0.30319/Temporary ASP.NET Files/WebSite/4ad5a27f/b4576cbe/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure.DLL.
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///E:/Foo/Bar/WebSite/bin/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure.DLL.
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///E:/Foo/Bar/WebSite/bin/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure.DLL.
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///C:/Windows/Microsoft.NET/Framework/v4.0.30319/Temporary ASP.NET Files/WebSite/4ad5a27f/b4576cbe/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure.EXE.
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///C:/Windows/Microsoft.NET/Framework/v4.0.30319/Temporary ASP.NET Files/WebSite/4ad5a27f/b4576cbe/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure.EXE.
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///E:/Foo/Bar/WebSite/bin/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure.EXE.
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///E:/Foo/Bar/WebSite/bin/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure/Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure.EXE.



Stack Trace: 



[FileNotFoundException: Could not load file or assembly 'Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified.]
   Autofac.Integration.Mvc.PreApplicationStartCode.Start() +0

[InvalidOperationException: The pre-application start initialization method Start on type Autofac.Integration.Mvc.PreApplicationStartCode threw an exception with the following error message: Could not load file or assembly 'Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified..]
   System.Web.Compilation.BuildManager.InvokePreStartInitMethodsCore(ICollection`1 methods, Func`1 setHostingEnvironmentCultures) +559
   System.Web.Compilation.BuildManager.InvokePreStartInitMethods(ICollection`1 methods) +132
   System.Web.Compilation.BuildManager.CallPreStartInitMethods(String preStartInitListPath, Boolean& isRefAssemblyLoaded) +102
   System.Web.Compilation.BuildManager.ExecutePreAppStart() +153
   System.Web.Hosting.HostingEnvironment.Initialize(ApplicationManager appManager, IApplicationHost appHost, IConfigMapPathFactory configMapPathFactory, HostingEnvironmentParameters hostingParameters, PolicyLevel policyLevel, Exception appDomainCreationException) +516

[HttpException (0x80004005): The pre-application start initialization method Start on type Autofac.Integration.Mvc.PreApplicationStartCode threw an exception with the following error message: Could not load file or assembly 'Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35' or one of its dependencies. The system cannot find the file specified..]
   System.Web.HttpRuntime.FirstRequestInit(HttpContext context) +9913572
   System.Web.HttpRuntime.EnsureFirstRequestInit(HttpContext context) +101
   System.Web.HttpRuntime.ProcessRequestNotificationPrivate(IIS7WorkerRequest wr, HttpContext context) +254




Version Information: Microsoft .NET Framework Version:4.0.30319; ASP.NET Version:4.0.30319.18408  
```

We deploy this web app using MSDeploy to create a package file. The package file contents are then deployed to the QA server. This is an exception I only see in our QA environment where we don't have Visual Studio installed.

The issue seems to be that we are not deploying Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure.dll.

When I looked at the Autofac.Mvc5.nuspec file in the Autofac.Mvc5 nuget package version 3.3.2 I saw that the declared dependencies are Autofac version [3.4.0, 4.0.0) and Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc version [5.1.0, 6.0.0).

``` xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<package xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <metadata xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/packaging/2010/07/nuspec.xsd">
    <id>Autofac.Mvc5</id>
    <version>$AFversion_Autofac.Mvc5$</version>
    <authors>Autofac Contributors</authors>
    <licenseUrl>http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php</licenseUrl>
    <requireLicenseAcceptance>false</requireLicenseAcceptance>
    <description>ASP.NET MVC 5 Integration for Autofac</description>
    <summary>Provides an IDependencyResolver implementation and other integration points for System.Web.Mvc.</summary>
    <language>en-US</language>
    <title>Autofac ASP.NET MVC 5 Integration</title>
    <projectUrl>http://autofac.org</projectUrl>
    <iconUrl>http://code.google.com/p/autofac/logo</iconUrl>
    <dependencies>
      <dependency id="Autofac" version="[3.4.0,4.0.0)" />
      <dependency id="Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc" version="[5.1.0,6.0.0)" />
    </dependencies>
  </metadata>
</package>
```

When I looked at the Autofac.Integration.Mvc\packages.config file, it seems like there are more assemblies from the NuGet packages folder that are direct dependencies of the Autofac.Mvc5 NuGet package.

``` xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<packages>
  <package id="Autofac" version="3.4.0" targetFramework="net45" />
  <package id="Microsoft.AspNet.Mvc" version="5.1.0" targetFramework="net45" />
  <package id="Microsoft.AspNet.Razor" version="3.1.0" targetFramework="net45" />
  <package id="Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages" version="3.1.0" targetFramework="net45" />
  <package id="Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure" version="1.0.0.0" targetFramework="net45" />
</packages>
```

To fix this issue, Microsoft.AspNet.Razor, Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages, and Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure should be dependencies of the Autofac.Mvc5 NuGet package.

One other thing: when I looked at the Autofac.Integration.Mvc.dll in Telerik JustDecompile I saw that of 
the assemblies Microsoft.AspNet.Razor, Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages, and Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure, only Microsoft.Web.Infrastructure is actually referenced. Is this an indication that Microsoft.AspNet.Razor and Microsoft.AspNet.WebPages do not need to be referenced by Autofac.Integration.Mvc?

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
